solution_line_template: If table C had ${money_more_C_than_A} more than table A, then table C had ${money_more_C_than_A}+${money_on_A}=$<<{money_more_C_than_A}+{money_on_A}={money_on_C}>>{money_on_C}
Roulette tables A and C had ${money_on_C}+${money_on_A}=$<<{money_on_C}+{money_on_A}={money_on_A_and_C}>>{money_on_A_and_C}
Table B had twice as much money on it as table C, meaning table B had ${money_on_C}*{multiplier_B_vs_C}=$<<{money_on_C}*{multiplier_B_vs_C}={money_on_B}>>{money_on_B}
Together, the three roulette tables had ${money_on_B}+${money_on_A_and_C}=$<<{money_on_B}+{money_on_A_and_C}={total_money}>>{total_money}
